game
Class Piece

java.lang.Object
  game.Piece
All Implemented Interfaces:
SpecialAbility
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
implements SpecialAbility

An abstract class providing with the default functions of all game pieces.

Author:
Tuure Saloheimo

Parameters:
atk - the attack power of the Piece
def - the defense value of the Piece
hp - the current hit points of the Piece
fhp - the maximum hit points of the Piece
team - the team the Piece belongs to
board - the Board the Piece is located on
row - the row of the Piece's location
column - the column of the Piece's location
hasMoved - whether the Piece has moved or not

A method that tells whether the Piece can move or not.

Returns:
false if canMove is false or hit points are 0 (or lower), true otherwise

A method used to damage the Piece accordingly to the attack power given as parametre.

Parameters:
attack - the attack power used to damage the Piece
Returns:
the amount of damage inflicted

heal

void heal(int amount)
Restores hit points to the Piece according to the amount given as parametre. The current hit points cannot rise over the maximum hit points using this method.

Parameters:
amount - the amount of hit points to be healed (the maximum value).

Moves the Piece to the location defined by the values given as parametres.

Parameters:
row - the row of the target square
column - the column of the target square

canMoveTo

public abstract boolean canMoveTo(int row,
                                  int column)
A method that tells whether the Piece in question can move to the square defined by the values given as parametres.

Parameters:
row - the row of the target square
column - the column of the target square
Returns:
true if moving is possible, false if it isn't

                                    int column)
A method that tells whether the Piece can attack the square defined by the values given as parametres.

Parameters:
row - the row of the target square
column - the column of the target sqaure
Returns:
true if attacking is possible, false otherwise

attack

public void attack(Piece piece)
A method used to attack the Piece given as parametre.

Parameters:
piece -

getDamage

public int getDamage(int attack)
A method that returns the attack to be inflicted to this Piece when it's attacked with the attack power given as parametre. This method does not alter the Piece's hit points. However, it does make sure the damage is at most the amount of the Piece's current hit points.

Parameters:
attack - the attack used to damage this Piece
Returns:
the amount of damage to be inflicted

getInitialDamage

public static final int getInitialDamage(int attack,
                                         int defense)
A method used to receive the initial damage with the attack and defense values given as parametres. The value can be larger than the defender's current hit points.

Parameters:
attack - the attack of the attacker
defense - the defense of the defender
Returns:
the amount of damage to be initially inflicted

canUseSpecialTo

public boolean canUseSpecialTo(int row,
                               int column)
Description copied from interface: SpecialAbility
Returns the boolean value of whether the object that implements the interface can use it's special ability to the coordinates defined by the given integer values.

Specified by:
canUseSpecialTo in interface SpecialAbility
Parameters:
row - The row of the target square
column - The column of the target square
Returns:
whether the target is valid for the special ability or not

useSpecialTo

public boolean useSpecialTo(int row,
                            int column)
Description copied from interface: SpecialAbility
Uses the special ability on the coordinates defined by the parameter values. This method usually doesn't check whether the use is possible, at least not as thoroughly as the canUse-method. However, sometimes it does, or asks for user input, and the special ability may not be used succesfully. On these occasions the method will return the value false.

Specified by:
useSpecialTo in interface SpecialAbility
Parameters:
row - The row of the target square
column - The column of the target square
Returns:
Whether the special ability was succesfully used.

getSpecialAbility

public java.lang.String getSpecialAbility()
Description copied from interface: SpecialAbility
This nethod returns the String-representation e.g. the name of the special ability.

Specified by:
getSpecialAbility in interface SpecialAbility
Returns:
the name of the special ability
